page.title: 12A local shop in Evie
page.content: Jock Spence is a local shopkeeper, who has lived in Evie all his life. He has a bar with his shop and both are called Mistra. He has worked in local shops for 34 years and has seen many changes. Mr Spence thought that there are fewer customers using the local shops. They all flock to Kirkwall to the bigger stores and supermarkets. Sweets used to be very cheap. Caramels, which are 34p per quarter nowadays, were 2 old pence per quarter Boiled sweets were very popular and chocolate was quite scarce. Children got very little pocket money. People didn't have much spare money after the war. Mr Spence remembered boys helping to fish for lobsters to get a bit more pocket money. They used to meet for a yarn or to play football.
